long: Meaning: to "totter" or "waver" (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to "falter", "stumble", "faint" or "fall".  Usage: bereave (from the margin), cast down, be decayed, (cause to) fail, (cause, make to) fall (down, -ing), feeble, be (the) ruin(-ed, of), (be) overthrown, (cause to) stumble, Ã— utterly, be weak.  Source: a primitive root;
